# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is an example of how you can write the `wrap_string` function in Julia.
```julia-repl
function wrap_string(str, text_width = 10)
    # Initialize variables to store wrapped string and current line length
    wrapped_str = ""
    line_length = 0

    for word in split(str)
        if (line_length + length(word) + 1 > text_width) || (line_length == 0)
            # Append a new line if the current line would exceed max width or is empty
            wrapped_str *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        else
            # Add a space before appending the next word
            wrapped_str *= " "
            line_length += 1
        end
        
        # Append the current word to the wrapped string and update the line length
        wrapped_str *= word
        line_length += length(word)
    end
    
    return wrapped_str[2:end]  # Remove extra leading newline
end
```
Here is an example of how you can use the `wrap_string` function.
```julia-repl
# Test the wrap_string function with a sample text
text = "This is a sample text that needs to be wrapped in multiple lines."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println("Original Text: ", text)
println("Wrapped Text:", wrapped_text)
```
